President Borough of Manhattan.

September 18, 1921.

(1)
31st Street, 10th to 9th Avenue.
(Before reconstruction).

(2)

President Borough of Manhattan.

September 18, 1921.

Ninth Avenue at S. E. corner of 31st Street.

December, 1925.

Photograph by Brown Brothers.

West 31st Street (right), east from but not including Ninth Ave., showing in the foreground the yards of the Pennsylvania Railroad and the rear of the General Post Office. The latter faces on Eighth Ave., and extends north to West 33rd Street (left). On the opposite of Eighth Ave. is the Pennsylvania Railroad Station extending to Seventh Ave., and across it, the Equitable Life Assurance Society Building, on the east side of Seventh Ave., from West 31st to West 32nd Streets. On the left (West 33rd Street) appears the Collegiate Baptist Church and the Printing Crafts Building; the latter being on the west side of Eighth Ave. and extending from West 33rd to West 34th Streets. Shown under construction are the Nelson Tower, on the west side of Seventh Ave., between  West 34th and West 35th Streets, and the 19-story building of R.H. Macy and Company, on the east side of Seventh Ave., between West 34th and West 35th Streets.

1929

Ewing Galloway

(1)
Ninth Ave. (foreground), north from and including West 31st (right), to and including West 33rd Streets, showing the general Post Office building extending eastward to Eighth Ave. On the east side of Eighth Ave., and extending eastward to Seventh Ave. appears the Pennsylvania Railroad Station. Directly across same (right) is the 26-story Equitable Life Assurance Society Building, on the east side of Seventh Ave. from West 31st to West 32nd Streets, and the Pennsylvania Hotel, from West 32nd to West 33rd Streets. In the background appear the lower stories of the Empire State Building, and (left) the 45-story Nelson Tower, No. 446-456 Seventh Ave., between West 34th and West 35th Streets. This photograph was taken from No. 424-438 West 32nd Street, a 12-story building between Ninth and Tenth Aves.

December 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view, but showing the Empire State Building in its entirety, before the observation tower was fully completed.

December 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as view No. 2.

December 20, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

Ninth Avenue, east side, north from West 31st to 33rd St's., showing the Pennsylvania Railroad yards to the rear of the General Post Office. The latter faces on Eighth Avenue. West 33rd Street is on the far side, containing the rears of the Y.M.C.A's Sloan House and the J.C. Penney Bldg. Adjoining the last is the Glad Tidings Assembly. The old Manhattan Opera House and the Hotel New Yorker, both on 34th Street near Eighth Avenue, project above the roof of the latter. In the center background is the dominant McGraw-Hill Bldg. on West 42nd Street. The photographers vantage point is given as the Sears Roebuck Bldg. at the S.E. corner of Ninth Avenue and West 31st Street.

About 1933

Berenice Abbott

Ninth Avenue, east side, north from and including 31st Street.

July 21, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
